param.name: cell_type
param.label: Cell type
param.help: Define the name of your cell type for a correct naming schema.

param.name: output-prefix
param.help: All output files will begin with the value of this argument.

param.label: Chicago data objects
param.help: ChicagoData objects, in either .Rda or .Rds form. If .Rda, there must be only one chicagoData object in the file.

param.label: Summary Input
param.help: An .Rda file of summary information -- the max P-val for each putative interaction, and the location of the .rmap file. This file will be generated if it wasn't provided.

param.label: Threshold
param.help: Threshold applied to log(p) values (NB: not the CHiCAGO score!). In other words, log(p) must be below this value in all of the samples. [default: -10]

param.label: Subsets
param.help: To ensure robustness, the data are partitioned into approximately equal subsets. Parameters are estimated separately on each subset. Then, an estimate for each parameter is derived from its median value across subsets. The number of subsets is controlled by this argument. [default: 5]

section.name: bins_parameters
section.title: Bins parameters
section.help: Parameters pertaining to the bins used in the analysis. Default breaks occur at 0, 31.25k, 62.5k, 125k, 250k, 500k, 1m, 2m, 3m, 4m, ..., 16m. The breaks are constructed by taking [binNumber] bins of size [largeBinSize], then breaking the first bin into two, iterating [halfNumber] times. [default: 1000000, 16, 5]

param.label: Half number
param.help: First bin is subdivided into halves - the number of times to do this [default: 5]
